companyInfo/companyDescription: Located near the north end of Osoyoos Lake in BC’s fabled Okanagan Valley, Burrowing Owl Estate Winery is devoted to crafting world-class wines in an environmentally-sustainable manner. Founder Jim Wyse has always had a strong commitment to striving for balance in all things, and this philosophy infuses everything that’s done at Burrowing Owl, from viticulture to winemaking. In the vineyard, the natural balance is maintained by recruiting bluebirds and bats to help control harmful insects; at the winemaking facilities, state-of-the-art technology is employed along with traditional winemaking methods. Remarkable for its strikingly beautiful setting as well as its environmental leadership, the winery has become a destination for wine lovers around the globe: every year Burrowing Owl welcomes over 100,000 visitors at its Wine Shop, Sonora Room Restaurant, and Guest House. Burrowing Owl’s success has also benefited our feathered friends, as the winery supports conservation work that is helping its namesake, the endangered burrowing owl, make a comeback in British Columbia.

Who are we?
We are more than a hotel chain. We are BC’s finest family-owned collection of resorts, hotels, and inns with locations in 13 destinations across the province. Hard work, kindness, and delivering superior guest experiences with a personal touch are at the forefront of our company’s values.
Read our story at: https://www.prestigehotelsandresorts.com/about-us/our-story/
What is in it for you?

 Be a part of a company that wants to make a difference in BC communities (visit our website to read about our love for Joe Anna's House and our Go Green Program)
 Competitive hourly wage ($19 per hour)
 Restaurant and Hotel discounts
 Office located in beautiful downtown Kelowna!
 Free onsite parking

What does an ideal candidate look like?

 Perfectionist: someone who excels at admin tasks
 High attention to detail as accuracy is crucial
 Positive attitude and good communication skills
 The ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
 The ability to relate to the public in a friendly and professional manner
 Strong time management skills and ability to work well under pressure
 Proficient use of computer programs
 Must be legally entitled to work in Canada

Scope of Responsibility
The Research & Support Student Intern will assist our Operations, Sales & Marketing, and Human Resources Department. This role performs administrative support, researching, and reporting, among other tasks and projects assigned to support our office and hotel properties.  Conducting research into prospective new clients in a variety of markets including corporate, sports, association and others, and then conducting cold/warm calls and emails to potential new clients in an effort to secure future business
 Reviewing guest feedback and reputation management support software and helping to create strategies, policy, and training in order to improve the guest experience
 Supporting the creation of promotional materials and marketing
 Help create monthly and quarterly production reports on behalf of all hotels that our corporate office supports
 Assist with data entry for Request for Proposals and online hotel listings
 Summarizing and creating policy and presentations to help train staff in the area of liquor licensing that reflects recent changes in the laws
 Investigating and summarizing what products General Managers are using at their properties and researching quotes for equipment, products, or service plans are needed at those properties as result. Examining the effectiveness of those products.
 Supporting the Human Resources department through reference checking
 Some administrative work to help organize online folders, recreate labels, adjust spreadsheets, and create templates in order to support our Operations Department
 Other duties as assigned by supervisor to support Operations, Sales & Marketing, and Human Resources Departments

 Discounted or free food
 On-site parking

About Us:
Foothills Creamery has proudly produced dairy products and served Western Canada for over 50 years. We produce butter and ice cream, now offering over 80 different flavours of ice cream, sorbet, sherbet, and soft serve. We take pride in using locally sourced ingredients and continue to use the same old-fashioned, barrel churned techniques as we did in 1969.
Foothills Creamery is committed to growing our passionate and friendly staff, providing excellent customer service, and producing the highest quality ice cream and dairy products for Canadians.
The Role:
The Sales & Brand Ambassador is responsible for supporting Foothills Creamery’s Sales and Marketing team. This person will professionally engage and interact with stakeholders, customers, and prospects to provide information, support, and spread brand awareness.
What You’ll Do:

 Work closely with Territory Sales Managers to support customers and provide a high level of customer service
 Coordinate with existing customers to ensure adequate stock levels through key selling periods
 Educate customers on specific product features and benefits
 Distribute point-of-sales materials to scoop shop and retail customers
 Collect market information while in the field on Foothills Creamery customers and competitors
 Support content creation for social media channels
 Support the execution of events, festivals, and activations
 Collect materials, set up and tear down of events, festivals, and activations
 Potential for assistance with warehouse and shipping, as required
 Contribute to positive employee relationships through effective communication, teamwork and partnership with co-workers and leadership
 Be a positive advocate for the Foothills Creamery brands and clients by acquiring a strong familiarity with our products, purpose, and vision
 Able to pivot and adapt quickly in a fast-paced changing environment
 Able to travel as well as work evenings and weekends as needed
 Performing other duties as assigned

What You’ll Need:

 Working towards Bachelor’s Degree in Business (currently enrolled) or a similar field or recently graduated
 Proficiency in Microsoft Office – intermediate knowledge in Excel and PowerPoint
 Strong organizational skills
 Physical ability to lift (up to) 40lbs

What You’ll Bring:

 Analytical capability to organize data, generate reports, and communicate insights
 Collaborative and positive team attitude
 Ability to adapt and adjust to changing sales environments and priorities
 Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 Well-organized with ability to prioritize

Benefits and Perks:

 Competitive wages
 Multiple opportunities to grow your career
 Participation in committees and company events
 Free premium ice cream and butter products every month!

This is a seasonal internship that will run from May - August 2024.

About this Opportunity 
Make an impact! ERA is seeking a Technology Impact Intern. Reporting to ERA’s Technology Impact Director as part of the Technology & Innovation team, this position supports the development and communication of key learnings from technology and innovation projects across ERA’s $950M portfolio to accelerate decarbonization in the province of Alberta.
To be effective in this role the candidate must:

 Be passionate about innovation and emissions reduction technology and have an interest in directly contributing to the emissions reduction mandate of ERA.
 Be able to understand complex technical information and synthesize it in layman’s terms, in writing, presentation, and verbal formats.
 Be highly organized, possessing strong project coordination, time management, technical communication, and analytical skills.
 Enjoy working with a team of professionals with a variety of skillsets.
 Have the ability to work efficiently and collaboratively and ask questions when needed.

About the Position 

 Work with ERA’s technical and communications staff as well as funding recipients from industry to document, synthesize, and communicate lessons learned from key technology and innovation projects funded by ERA.
 Develop communication material describing key learnings and projects from ERA’s portfolio, spanning the areas of hydrogen, carbon capture, methane, renewables, oil and gas, and more.
 Collaborate and coordinate with teammates and funding recipients to develop and implement processes for storytelling and communication to maximize ERA’s impact, such as podcasts, webinars, workshops, and presentation material.

Qualifications and Skills

 Provide support to ERA’s technology intake process and competitive funding calls, such as notetaking and screening proposals. · Ensure integrity and consistency of public-facing project information.
 Be in progress of completing a technical post-secondary degree.
 Understand a variety of decarbonization technologies at a conceptual level.
 Be a strong communicator, able to understand complex technical information and synthesize it in layman’s terms, in writing, presentation, and verbal formats.
 Strive to work cross-organizationally with various parts of ERA’s team.
 Interact professionally with ERA recipients and external contractors.

Competencies

 Strong organizational and time-management ability, with attention to detail.
 Ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks, competing agendas and demands.
 Proven analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
 Research, writing, presentation and editing skills.
 Thrives in both well-defined and ambiguous planning and project cycles. Capable of engaging with team members to define outcomes and achieve results.

Compensation and Location
This is a full time role from May to August 2024. The pay range for this position is $19-$23/hour, dependent on skill set and qualifications.
This role will be located at either ERA’s Edmonton or Calgary office, with a preference towards Edmonton, but candidates from anywhere within driving distance of Edmonton or Calgary are welcome to apply. In recognition of flexible needs of team members, ERA has adopted a hybrid work policy with a minimum of three days working in the office.
Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion
In addition to the above skills and experience, Emissions Reduction Alberta is committed to an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workforce and Board. Applications from all qualified persons are welcome and we encourage women; First Nations, Métis and Inuit; members of visible minority groups; persons with disabilities; persons of any sexual orientations or gender identity and expression; and all those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas to apply.
Application
To apply for this position, please submit a cover letter and resume to Emissions Reduction Alberta at hr@eralberta.ca no later than close of business on March 15, 2024.

description:
Embark on a Culinary Adventure with Smokeshow BBQ at The Hatching Post!
 
  Are you a culinary enthusiast with a passion for the art of BBQ? Do you dream of honing your skills in an environment buzzing with innovation, creativity, and a deep camaraderie? Look no further! Smokeshow BBQ at The Hatching Post, an esteemed member of the Jason Parkes Customs family, is thrilled to extend an exclusive invitation to Culinary Arts students from Okanagan College for an unparalleled Co-op Placement opportunity.
  Nestled in the heart of culinary innovation, Smokeshow BBQ is not just a BBQ joint; it's a sanctuary where the traditional meets the extraordinary, creating an unforgettable experience for both our team and our guests. As part of our dynamic team, you'll have the unique chance to:
 
 
   Learn from the Best: Work side-by-side with seasoned artisans and BBQ enthusiasts who share your passion and are eager to pass on their knowledge and skills.
   Craft Impeccable BBQ Dishes: This is your canvas to experiment, innovate, and perfect your BBQ techniques, contributing to a menu that wows every guest.
   Shape Your Culinary Path: With us, you're not just completing a placement; you're carving a niche for yourself in the culinary world, building a foundation that will support your future endeavours.
 
 
  What You’ll Do:
 
   Cooking on the line and prepping for service.
   Preparing orders as they come in and executing them to company standards.
   Daily duties include cleaning and organizing to ensure a smooth operation.
 
 
  What We Need from You:
 
   Whether you're just starting or you bring a wealth of experience, we welcome your application.
   A passion and commitment to hospitality, teamwork, and fun.
   An eagerness to learn, coupled with an openness to feedback, coaching, and mentorship.
   The ability to follow recipes and take instructions from our Chef and Sous Chef.
   Great knife skills are a definite asset, as is Food Safe certification.
   A commitment to fostering a supportive and engaging experience for both your team members and our guests.
 
 
  At Smokeshow BBQ, we believe in nurturing talent and fostering an environment where creativity can flourish. This Co-op Placement is more than a learning opportunity—it's your first step towards becoming a culinary artist, making a mark in BBQ and beyond.
  
 
 
   Are you ready to join a team where every day is a chance to learn, grow, and ignite your culinary passion? Smokeshow BBQ at The Hatching Post is waiting for you. Let's create something unforgettable together.
 
 
  To learn more about working at The Hatching Post, please visit https://www.jasonparkescustoms.com/pages/careers.

SKYTRAC, an aerospace leader in Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellite communications and intelligent connectivity, provides innovative technology solutions to some of the world’s largest organizations.

description:
Join Our Dynamic Team at SKYTRAC 
 About Us: 
  SKYTRAC is at the forefront of revolutionizing aviation communication through cutting-edge satellite technologies. Trusted by operators, organizations, and OEMs alike, SKYTRAC is has over 800+ customers as a leading provider of Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellite and cellular communication services for all aerospace sectors. We are not just shaping the future of connectivity in aviation, we're redefining it! 
 Learn more about what we do 
  Our environment: 
  As an aerospace leader, we at SKYTRAC, are an adaptable, agile, and hardworking team of passionate experts. While we may operate within a fast-paced and sometimes chaotic work environment, we are also able to grow, develop and hone our skills – making us the subject matter experts we are today. As a part of our team, you'll work with like-minded individuals who share your passion for pushing the boundaries of what’s possible; working together to support each other. You’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented colleagues, and make a meaningful impact on our projects. 
 We understand the importance of fostering a positive workplace culture. From team-building activities to social events, we ensure our team members have opportunities to unwind, connect, and have fun together. 
  Your Mission 
 You will play a pivotal role in supporting our organization's technology infrastructure and operations. Working closely with IT team, you will gain hands-on experience in various aspects of IT, including technical support, system administration, network management, and project assistance. The primary objective of this position is to contribute to the smooth functioning of our IT systems and services while learning and developing valuable skills in a professional environment. 
  You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills and are eager to learn and adapt to new technologies and tasks. 
  This position is located in-office in Kelowna, BC. 
  A day in the life: 
 
   Receives and responds to user requests for assistance sent to IT Help Desk in a courteous manner.
   Diagnoses and resolves computer -related problems for Laptop / desktop computers.
   Checks servers, backups, phone systems and environment controls.
   Implements, installs, troubleshoots and supports the application of third-party systems, in-house software, desktop hardware/software, printers and other office systems, network, voicemail and phone systems.
   Creates and manages user accounts.
   Perform hands-on tasks at the desktop level, including installing and upgrading software and hardware, implementing file backups, and configuring systems and applications.
   Perform imaging of new/refurbished devices.
   Update IT Asset Database per hardware lifecycle changes.
   Update inventory of service spares/stock as items are received in asset management platform.
   Test potential defective hardware.
 
  QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE 
  Candidate Must Have’s 
 
   Currently enrolled in a degree program related to Computer Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a relevant field (2nd year or higher preferred).
   Basic understanding of computer hardware, operating systems, and networking concepts.
   Familiarity in Linux environments.
   Familiarity with a scripting language (perl, php, python, bash etc)
   Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and familiarity with troubleshooting tools.
   Available for an 8-month term - start date is flexible but no later than May 2024.
  
  Candidate Nice-to Have’s 
 
   Familiarity with Active Directory and Office 365
   Prior experience in IT support or related roles
  
  The salary range for this role is $24 per hour CAD.

   Other tasks as required

   Positive attitude

Culinary Intern
Job Type: Seasonal (May – October 2024)Mission Hill Family Estate WineryWest Kelowna, Okanagan Valley, British Columbia
Be part of the next great story in wine!
Mission Hill Family Estate:
Over 40 years ago, we founded our family winery with an audacious dream – to redefine what’s possible for Canadian wine in the eyes of the world. With a deep commitment to the Okanagan region, and a relentless passion to produce wines that can stand alongside the best in the world, our wines are crafted with bold precision and an uncompromising respect for the diverse vineyards and micro-climates here.
Our Culture:
Our culture is unapologetically fast paced, entrepreneurial, and results driven. Each team member is a storyteller and makes an impact on a family-owned business that is building a lasting legacy in the Canadian and International wine industry. Our people have relentless drive to always raise the bar, a genuine entrepreneurial spirit, a passion, and love for what we do, to all act like owners, and to constantly innovate. We act with a sense of urgency, do everything possible to always overdeliver for our customers, and treat each other with humility and authenticity.
Who We Are:
We love what we do. We’re all in. It’s how we have accomplished great things. Like our amazing products and our brand, we want to tell you the exciting story of our winery, its growth, and our people. We’re on an amazing adventure and we want you to help write the next chapter with us. We are building a lasting legacy in the wine industry, and we’ve only just begun.
Your Culinary Journey:
At Mission Hill Family Estate, our culinary program is dedicated to the sourcing and promotion of local, sustainable, seasonal food. Our Cuisine du Terroir approach lends itself to a light-handed manner of preparation that respects the character of the ingredient and where it is sourced. Our varietal and herb gardens are steps away from our kitchens, and we educate and encourage our team members to explore foraging opportunities that lay at our doorstep.
From farm tours to food and wine tastings, we strive to ensure our team acquires the knowledge and appreciation of the valley and the winery needed to surpass our guests’ expectations. Each team member will have the opportunity to hone their culinary skills and develop professional relationships that will last a lifetime while working with our accomplished and celebrated culinary team.
The Life of a Culinary Intern:

 Work cooperatively under the direction of the senior Chefs on all matters of the kitchen
 Demonstrate a high level of professionalism and a ‘can do’ attitude in the kitchen
 Execute dishes to the exact standards as set by the Sous Chef

What We’re Looking For:

 Current “Food Safe” certification (or equivalent)
 Flexible scheduling - working days, evenings and weekends required
 You thrive in ambiguity and are comfortable with change
 You put trust in others and never let anyone down
 You listen, take feedback, respond quickly, and take initiative with a sense of urgency
 You are authentic, diplomatic, thoughtful, and always have the best intentions

Bonus Points:

 Second language considered an asset

What We Offer:

 Comprehensive paid training and access to extensive wine education
 Competitive wages
 Discounts at the Terrace Restaurant, Events, and at our Boutique on gifts and wine
 Free tastings for you and your guests
 Discounts on tours and Experiences
 The opportunity to work in a “Post Card” setting on our iconic property

At Mission Hill, we live by our 5 Core Values every day:
Sense of Urgency

 Our business moves fast and so do we. We understand the power of now.
 We have relentless drive and believe if it can be done, we’re the ones who will do it first.

Authenticity

 We need to stay real because our brands, our stories and our culture must remain genuine to thrive.
 When we have the best intentions for all, we create space to be our whole selves and do great things together.

Simplicity

 Our lives are complicated enough. So why use 50 words when you can use 5?
 We thrive in ambiguity and change, but we also know how to translate our goals into simple explanations and actions.

Humility

 Egos distract us. When we’re humble, we’re open to listen, take feedback and change direction quickly.
 We’re here for each other, and together we do great things.

Trust

 We respect and rely on each other. Trust is the backbone of our relationships, and we work hard not to break it.
 This level of trust allows us to be all-in and take comfort in the support of our teams.

We want to hear from you! Apply on our website today: www.missionhillwinery.com/Work-With-Us/
Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal, Internship / Co-op
Salary: $18.00-$20.00 per hour
Supplemental pay types:

 Overtime pay
 Tips

description:
ABOUT US: 
  SKYTRAC, an aerospace leader in Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellite communications and intelligent connectivity, provides innovative technology solutions to some of the world’s largest organizations. 
 SKYTRAC provides critical connectivity solutions to thousands of end users across the globe. With more than 800 customers operating 8,000+ aircraft on all seven continents, our commitment to excellence has established us as a trusted partner within the aerospace sector. As a provider of satellite and cellular airtime, as well as mission services to multiple segments of aviation, operators, systems integrators, and aircraft manufacturers rely on SKYTRAC as a capable and committed technology partner. 
  Engineer your career with SKYTRAC 
  CO-OP OPPORTUNITY SUMMARY: 
  Our rapidly growing company is committed to fostering development of new and rising talent in the engineering field, offering university students in their 3rd or 4th year of study eight months of valuable hands-on experience within the aviation industry. 
 Our internship program is designed to prepare students for career and employment readiness. Interns will be assigned to a core department but could have the opportunity to participate in cross-departmental projects. 
 
  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 
  Commitment to learning and excellence
   Professionalism in presentation and conduct
   Strong integrity and work ethic
   Willingness to go the extra mile
   Strong oral and written communication skills
  
  SW Test Co-op (based out of our Kelowna, BC office) 
  The Software Test team verifies both embedded and enterprise software. It ensures the quality of the designed software meets the defined requirements. 
  A typical day could include: 
 
   Developing, maintaining, and testing embedded software applications
   Developing and maintaining software configuration management and automation scripts
   Designing and writing test plans for software verification
   Contributing to a team of professional SW engineers as part of the development life cycle of a new SW feature release
   Following a SW Testing process to define a strategy to validate and verify the requirements of this new SW development project
   Supporting a project team to trouble shoot a given system integration solution
   Receiving training in the latest SATCOM technologies
   Providing lesson learns to, and receive feedback from, your peers for your project as part of an on-going improvement of a SDLC process
 
  PREFFERED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: 
 
  Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree or College Diploma in Engineering program (Electrical/Computer/Software), Computer Science or related subject
   Programming using C/C++, HTML and Java Script with an emphasis on C programming
   Knowledge of electronics at the circuit board level
   An understanding of good engineering practices in hardware, software and electronic design
   Understanding of safety critical environment, problem solving and debugging skills
  
  WE OFFER: 
 
   Learning, learning and more learning!
   Professional meaningful work 
  Realtime on-the-job training 
  Mentorship 
  Cross functional exposure and experience
   A team you can belong to and believe in 
  A passionate, intelligent culture 
  Consideration for continued employment 
  Gain exposure to the exciting and increasingly growing aerospace industry working with the largest brands in aviation
  
  The hourly wage for third and fourth year co-op students is $24.00 CAD.
